data.text:
exp.

Used to express that it is impossible to decide between two options because they're equal

English expression

n.

specific language used in the Pentagon

n.

Relasd/her/s/article/Give-to-get-policy?language=en_US&utm_source=onboarding&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=onboarding_us&utm_content=ob_us_r.p

n.

a broad difference in values and attitudes between one and another especially between parents and their children

v.

to localize a website is to translate it in the local language of the ones who will read it.

id.

the phrase is uttered in an attempt to excuse the user of profanity or curses in the presence of those offended by it under the pretense of the words being part of a foreign language

Syn.: excuse my French

n.

Linguistics/Instant assessment of native-level English language skills. (Group) اللغويات / التقييم الفوري لمهارات اللغة الإنجليزية على المستوى الأصلي.

Search engine SEO Test your skills: HTML accessibility Strategies for carrying out testing Answer: As a web development-focused assistant, I can provide information related to web development, including search engine optimization (SEO) and web accessibility, but I don't have specific details about exams for search engine evaluators. For information on the specific exams or qualifications required for search engine evaluators, I recommend reaching out to the relevant certification or training providers in this field. Was this answer useful? YES, THIS ANSWER WAS USEFUL. NO, THIS ANSWER WAS NOT USEFUL. R Linguistics/Instant assessment of native-level English language skills اللغويات / التقييم الفوري لمهارات اللغة الإنجليزية على المستوى الأصلي. Additional comments:

n.

artificial long word coined to mean a lung disease known as silicosis, a type of pneumoconiosis caused by inhalation of ultra-microscopic particles of crystalline silica volcanic dust. It has the particularity of being the longest word in the English language published in a dictionary

Longer tech. terms exist (up to 189,819 letters!).The word, presumably coined in 1935 by E.M. Smith (pres. of the National Puzzlers'League) in imitation of very long medical terms, contains 45 letters

n.

Textual content from one language to another, and outstanding linguistic and cultural skills.

As a translator responsible for reading and translating the text. ex."He wishes to translate thier textual works"
